intro: Schilleria ulmifolia, commonly known as the elm-leaved schilleria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped, palmate leaves that resemble those of an elm tree. It produces showy, pale yellow to white flowers arranged in clusters. Schilleria ulmifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
